p.em: Match the hormone with the stimulus for release.

response.feedback: Correct. Aldosterone release is directly stimulated by high plasma concentrations of potassium. Aldosterone release is also stimulated by angiotensin II. The insertion of more sodium transporters in the collecting ducts results in increased leakage of potassium to the collecting duct lumen.

Incorrect. Aldosterone does have an effect on blood pressure, but aldosterone release is directly stimulated by high plasma concentrations of potassium. Aldosterone release is also stimulated by angiotensin II. The insertion of more sodium transporters in the collecting ducts results in increased leakage of potassium to the collecting duct lumen.

Incorrect. Antidiuretic hormones act to decrease urine production by increasing the permeability of principal cells in the late distal convoluted tubule and the collecting duct. Aldosterone acts to increase plasma potassium concentration which results in increased leakage of potassium to the collecting duct lumen.
Incorrect. Atrial natriuretic peptide is released from the heart in response to large increases in blood volume. Conversely, aldosterone is activated when blood volume and blood pressure decrease.
